item.description:
This is the 3rd annual Boston SciFi/Fantasy Picnic! We know the day star is scary, and that Mansquito has left many of us unwilling to venture outdoors, but for one day, we brave the wilderness and play in the grassy fields of Boston Common. Join us for a day of fun, friends, and games, both physical and board. Here's how it works:

We will meet up at Brewer Fountain (it is the newly renovated large fountain next to the Park St. Subway entrance, see http://wikimapia.org/4480692/Brewer-Fountain and http://boston.cbslocal.com/2011/03/23/boston-common%E2%80%99s-facelift-begins-at-brewer-fountain/ ) from 10:30 to 11:00 AM. At 11, we'll head out and find a big open patch of field to sit, talk, eat, and play games. If you arrive later, or can't find us, feel free to call me (Tom) at 617-899-8445.

Things to Bring:

  • Blankets
  • Chairs
  • Outdoor games (e.g. frisbee,  bocce ball)
  • Board games (although, ones with many tiny pieces may not be a good choice)
  • Food (this is not a catered event, but if you are generous and bring food to share, you will make new friends)
  • Cold Drinks (you can bring Hot Drinks if you want, but remember, this is Summer)
  • Picnic Supplies
  • Bug Spray
  • Children are welcome (as long as they are supervised and behaved). Keep in mind that this event is not a day care or a field trip. Also, you do not need to adopt a child to attend. :)

 

Things you should not bring:

  • Pets (I know that you love your dog/cat/spitting cobra/targ/tauntaun, but please leave them at home.)
  • Alcoholic Beverages (I hate to be a buzzkill, but it isn't legal in the Common.)
  • Fireworks
  • Weapons
  • Anything else that could get you or other members of the group arrested
  • Anything really valuable that you would be heartbroken to have stolen/eaten/destroyed/rained on

Weather Note

Picnics in the rain are no fun. We'll watch the weather and if it looks like it will be a icky rainy day, we'll reschedule, so stay tuned.

 

Information about Boston Common:

 

Boston Common is one of the oldest city parks in the United States. You can get a map of the Boston Common here: http://www.cityofboston.gov/parks/streettrees/pdfs/boston_common.pdf
item.how_to_find_us: Meet us at the Brewer Fountain (the big fountain next to the Park St Subway entrance) or call me on my cell (617-899-8445).
item.name: 3rd Annual Summer Picnic Outing
